description_html:
Naja Utzon Popov's Oceania rug collection for Carl Hansen & Søn reflects the encounter between Scandinavian and Japanese nature, an inexhaustible treasure trove of shapes, colors, structures, and textures.

The two rugs in the Oceania collection, Coral and Seabed, bear clear references to water: one to the cryptic, underwater life of the coral reef, the other to the cracks and fissures in salt marches, dried sand or the crust of the sun-scorched earth. The pattern universe captures dynamic movement, which Utzon Popov feels expresses more of an emotional state that an actual exploration of specific marine environments.

Utzon Popov's color palette is inspired by Carl Hansen & Søn's classic furniture, creating and open dialogue with furniture design without dominating the overall impression. The rugs carry their own unique identity and interact freely with interior decor.

The rugs, available in three color combinations and three sizes, are hand-tufted from wool and sustainable Tencel derived from the fibers of beech tree. Tencel adds a soft, silky finish that elegantly contrasts with the wool's matte look, helping to highlight Utzon Popov's expressive patterns and colors.
